column4: hey why is ther no command line option to disable BLUETTOOTH SUPPORT in the installer
sorry typo. hey why is ther no command line option to disable BLUETOOTH SUPPORT in the installer
what 3 different versions exactly?
I wouldn't be so sure this is a bluetooth issue.  Did you 'check the cd for defects'?  Did you try the alternate cd?
i did. SAME RESULT!
how would you describe the alternate cd in short
i tried three different versions of the install cd, same result
7.10 cd and dvd. and 8.10 cd
the alternate cd is not the same as the desktop cd
but it must be bluetooth issue since none of the above worked. no cd error.
not necessarily.  Just because the last thing you see on your screen is "no bluetooth [OK]" doesn't mean it's a bluetooth issue
what could it be????
it sucks
I don't know.  Try the alternate cd to see if it works
can you give me the link to the new 8.10 alternate? cant find it
check cdimage.ubuntu.com
not sure, but did you see the guide on help.ubuntu.com?
was trying to do it via the live cd, but cant but it
help on what?
I think there are instructions there on installing to usb
yes, that's on the page I linked you to
unfortunately it seems like it just uses the live cd to copy it over to a usb.  maybe you can find something though
try #ubuntu-offtopic for those type of questions
